description: This unit takes a comparative approach to the law of remedies for civil wrongs. It examines the treatment of selected remedial issues in various common law jurisdictions. The topics to be covered are likely to include: aims and methods of comparative legal studies; compensation for non-pecuniary loss in contract and tort; liability of multiple wrongdoers; gain-based remedies in contract and tort; punitive damages in contract and tort; and vindication as an aim of damages; and specific relief and personal service agreements.
